864949671:
[

Project Manager - 18 month contract

Company Name Vocus Group Limited Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 162 views

Job description

As the fourth largest Telco in Australia, Vocus Group continues to grow, and we are looking for an experienced Project Manager for an 18 month contract.

As a Project Manager, you will be part of the Vocus Coral Sea Cable project team within the Major Projects Group, and you will be required to provide support to the Senior Project Manager to manage the Vocus Marine Construction project and to oversee & monitor the construction of the cable landing stations and other landing site facilities at each cable landing. There is one in each of Australia and PNG and four in the Solomon Islands.

The occupant, together with the Senior Project Manager, will be responsible for managing the delivery of the overall project on time, within scope, quality and budget.

There is also a requirement to meet the customer’s ongoing project management contractual obligations in terms of conducting regular agreed meetings and producing various project documents, meeting minutes, tracking of actions and reporting. Other marine cable system projects are imminent, and the occupant would become involved in those.
\xa0
Other marine construction projects are nearing approval and there may be an opportunity to contribute to those in the future.

The day to day


  • Project control and governance: Ensure the Vocus control and governance processes are followed. Administer the Change Control Process and other related project management controls and documentation.
  • Project Meetings: Organise and facilitate various project meetings, including publishing agendas, minute taking and distribution of action items and relevant documentation.
  • Project Scheduling/ Resource Management: Develop, track and maintain Project Schedules, Resource Plans and related reports using a Project Management Tool (such as MS Project, Clarizen, etc).
  • Project Documents: Prepare various project management documents such as the Project Management and Quality Plan (PMQP) for new projects.
  • Issues & Risks Management: Identify, mitigate and monitor project risks through the Risk Management Procedures. Maintain the Issues and Risks Registers and assist with troubleshooting problems.
  • Reporting: Develop reports to track project progress and deliverables. Also provide input into monthly reporting for senior management required by the Project Director and Program Manager.
  • Procurement: Co-ordinate and track project procurement activities.
  • Workshops/ Events: Assist with organising any project related workshops and events.


What you need to bring to the table

  • Bachelor’s Degree in appropriate field of study, or equivalent work experience
  • Project management qualifications or certifications are highly desirable
  • 7+ years of project management experience in the telecommunications/ network infrastructure industry or similar
  • 5+ years of experience working with business stakeholders within a cross-functional matrix environment
  • Experience with working in government related projects is desirable

Guest Service Agent

Company Name Cushman & Wakefield Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 31 views

Job description

Job Title
Guest Service Agent

Job Description

 Job Description Summary

Guest Services Agent
  • Leading Global Commercial Real Estate Services Firm
  • Melbourne CBD offices
  • Permanent opportunity
When the expertise of a century in the market meets the entrepreneurial spirit of a startup, it creates an agile, insightful business that embraces change, with an appetite for calculated risk. By seeing things differently, Cushman & Wakefield anticipate market changes and are first to capitalise, ensuring clients and the business can be what’s next.

The Guest Services Agent will be responsible for the delivery of exceptional resident experiences for every interaction, whilst delivering a range of services. We focus on anticipating needs, listening to the resident and making the interaction simple, effective and quick. We then ensure we follow up the interaction to make sure our resident have all they require.

Key Responsibilities;

The role of Guest Service Agent (GSA) works across a wide variety of job tasks and areas and may also work across multiple buildings.

Customer Service
  • Meet and greet visitors proactively, with a professional greeting and smile
  • Answer the phone with a professional greeting within 3 rings, direct call as required
  • Manage group inboxes responding to email queries promptly
  • Establish 5 star rapport with all staff but particularly Senior Executives and their EA's
    Concierge
  • Issue, verify and collect access passes using the visitor registration system, which may also include management of lost/unreturned passes
  • Advise relevant staff on the arrival of their guests in a timely manner
  • Advise and/or escort guests to the relevant waiting lounge or room, as informed by resident. Advise guest of available facilities such as bathrooms, door access requirements etc.
    Meetings & Events
  • Promotion and execution of special events
  • Ensure rooms are clean and presented to the highest standard always
  • Liaise and provide support to event and meeting organisers to with room setup, catering and AV requirements
Security
  • Perform and manage all aspects of new employee induction tours, orientation, permanent access passes, security photographs and necessary paperwork
Key Requirements;
  • Very strong hospitality / customer service background
  • Professional verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to multi-task
  • Strong time management skills
  • Team management experience
  • No specific qualifications required
    Cushman & Wakefield is a large, global organization that cares about its people. If you are keen to work in a professional, energetic, and motivated business that takes pride in giving employees the opportunities to learn and advance their careers, then we would like to hear from you.

    As an Equal Opportunity Employer, Cushman & Wakefield encourages indigenous Australian and female candidates to apply.
Cushman & Wakefield provides equal employment opportunity. Discrimination of any type will not be tolerated. Cushman & Wakefield is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment withoutregard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law.

865101509:
[

Mobile Lending Manager - West Region

Company Name Bank of Melbourne Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 16 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Bank of Melbourne (BoM) isn't just another bank. In the last six years we’ve built a team dedicated to the needs of Victorians and their businesses. Our expert business bankers have deep sector knowledge and the insight to support businesses to succeed.

Through our partnerships with Victorian institutions and associations, we give our customers access to local networks and a home ground advantage. We’re a different kind of bank, and our entire destiny depends on what happens here in Victoria.

Our Opportunity

We are currently seeking experienced Mobile Lenders to join the Bank of Melbourne lending network. As a mobile lender you will travel frequently to meet customers at a time and place that's convenient for them & provide them advice on home lending & other banking products that best match their needs.

The mobile lender will manage the end-to-end home loan process for the customer from initial contact through to settlement and spend time building a network of referral sources in order to grow their business.

To help achieve their targets & customers' needs we have a dedicated team of lending assistants on hand to ensure our customers have a great experience. In addition to this our lending managers will work with a great team of leaders who will coach and mentor you throughout your time.

What You Bring To The Table

You will have a proven track record in home & investment lending as well as exposure to more complex lending solutions. You’ve developed a strong referral network and pride yourself on your ability to undertake quality conversations with our customers to identify the solution that is in their best interests.

You really love helping people and have already been building a successful career in customer-facing sales and service. You're known for building strong relationships, developing referral networks and generating new business.

You also deliver service that our customers tell their friends about. Complementing your experience & understanding of lending principles is a mind for details and a proven record of sound judgement and decision-making.

Why this role is for you

For a start, we think we’ve built a fantastic brand, business & culture for the region where you’ll love to come to work because you are both empowered & supported to achieve your personal & professional goals.

Bank of Melbourne provide our lender family with genuine support from multiple leaders within the business along with dedicated retail lending coaches. What we're trying to say is that you’ll be genuinely coached & supported by the family from day one.

We're a smaller bank therefor you will work closely with our leadership team & notice they are highly visible and accessible. Not only do you have the opportunity to get to know our leaders, you also have the opportunity to be closer to the strategy & even help mould it.

Finally, we reward & recognise our people for their hard work. We want our people to be successful & when they are we want them to follow their passions. What this means is that we take an active role in not only the role performance of our people, but also ensure each person has an embedded career development plan & we can help you get to those next steps.

In addition to the above, some other perks include;
  • Access to some of the best banking, wealth and insurance benefits in the market
  • A highly competitive remuneration that is fair and consistent for all of our people
  • Entitled to a suite of online learning, training modules and career planning tools to grow with us
  • Encouraged to participate in the community through paid volunteer leave and secondments available
Our commitment to you

Better banking can't be delivered without the right people. We understand that your satisfaction in what you do leads to our customers' satisfaction. We'll support and actively encourage your career development and growth, provide flexible work options and a host of some of the best financial & non-financial benefits out there.

Bank of Melbourne, as part of Westpac Group is an equal opportunity employer. As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility.

Where to from here?

If you would like to know more please contact Richard from the Bank of Melbourne recruitment team on Richard.maher@westpac.com.au

Job description

Professional Standards Lawyer

The opportunity and the role

As a Professional Standards Lawyer you will form part of our experienced and collegiate Professional Standards & Risk team. This is a small and dynamic team in which every person plays a pivotal role.

You will also collaborate closely with management and staff in the practice areas of the business and with staff in some of our shared services (Finance, IT, New Client Services, Human Resources, Learning & Development).

Reporting directly to the General Manager of Professional Standards & Risk, you will:
  • Assist to manage professional indemnity claims, regulatory complaints, disciplinary investigations or proceedings against the organisation or individual lawyers.
  • Provide risk management advice and assistance on client-related issues to lawyers across the business nationally.
  • Collaborate on practice improvement initiatives with managers of the practice areas of the business.
  • Drive professional risk awareness and a culture of continuous improvement in the quality of our legal services.
To be successful

Our ideal candidate will possess most of the following qualities and experience:
  • Experience working in private practice.
  • A background in professional indemnity claims, personal injury, commercial litigation or insurance litigation would be an advantage.
  • expertise in legal professional obligations and the regulatory framework across Victoria, New South Wales, Queensland and Western Australia.
  • Strong communication skills, with s solutions focussed and practical approach to the law.
  • Professional judgement to deal with a range of internal and external stakeholders with sensitivity and acumen.
  • Strong time management, organisational skills and drive.
We will consider flexible working arrangements, either full time or part time candidates may apply.

About Us

We are a leading consumer law firm and our aim is to guide our clients to a brighter outcome by
being passionate advocates of their best interests and champions of every client's cause.

We provide our employees a genuine opportunity for career development in a supportive work environment.

At Slater and Gordon we value high performance. We recognise the contribution of our
employees and reward them with a dedicated range of attractive benefits.

If you are interested in this opportunity please apply to Slater and Gordon directly following the link attached as we are not accepting applications from recruitment agencies.
